author: Michiel Van Roey
title: Dapp to control/monetize your data
description: $300B surveillance capitalism market broke the customer relationship. People should control and benefit from the use of their personal data

assessments.note: I would like to like this but I don't. First of all, if I understood correctly, this is an App where you specifically go and browse ads, is it? What about the 99.9999 % of other ad junk that we face every day in different media? Personally, I wouldn't use the app. Also, apart from using ADA for payments, what does it have to do with Cardano? Can't you build something like this even without blockchain?

It is a magnificent idea and something deffinitly needed in today social network circles. The challenge posed and the solution are a major step forward in materializing a proper model that can support both worlds and promotes more transparency to the process. No longer depending on the predatory nature of businesses taking advantage of data without proper consent as to their use. Proud that this solution is one being implemented in the Cardano network and would put a spotlight into the benfits of Cardano in such a huge pervasive aspect of user experience in the internet of things. The funds seam reasonable and the project been already built and seing example sketches of the product brings confidence to its succesful deployment.

This project has the potential to address data and privacy issue. Control over what your data is used for is very important and has been long in the hands of corporations who give out these services for what seems to be free.

I believe this proposal effectively addresses the challenge in fund 4.  Thee proposal is concise and addresses the need for adoption in 2021.  If adoption was widespread there would be a great impact on the Cardano ecosystem.  It does address a problem that needs to be solved, the community at large would definitely benefit.  However, without seeing a business plan that addresses how the Dapp will scale.  How will we get to 78,000 users?
This is interesting solution to a relevant problem, but the proposal is very similar to the Brave/BAT protocol which is well established.
This proposal does address the challenge at a basic level, but is a large undertaking and requires functionality not in place yet to really be successful.
User centric dapp for the consumers of future is a really great idea. Blockchains are all abt giving control of data and money in the hands of consumer which this app intends to do.

The team's names and pictures are available on the website*. However, ADA / Cardano is not mentioned even once (not even in the EULA). I get a feeling that you wanted to do this anyway and now you jumped on the opportunity to finance the developer's work via Project Catalyst. If that is the case, please say it directly.

*The website is buggy and not very user friendly. Tested with Brave and Chrome.

There is an abundance of research and good intent in the approach of the solution and the track record being deployed in California and Switzerland brings confidence to it solid grounding. Is good to know there is legal expert in the team and collaboration across the board.
The execution of this project hinges on the vision that has been presented. A good follow through roadmap will be key to tracking the progress of the project.

I believe feasibility of this proposal is quite nice.  The proposer has relevant experience.  Looks like he is building a team and is committed to the project whether it is funded or not.  I do believe however that the plan and budget for the task described is not sufficient to make a completely informed decision.

There's an extensive plan presented, but its very dense and not clear in places. The website for Profila presented is "broken" (i.e. is not working on Chrome). The proposal doesn't mention the several Data Protection Legislation frameworks that exist worldwide and how they would navigate this and ensure they operate within the legal framework. There's also no mention to the BAT/Brave system and how they system is different.

The budget and timeline seem way too low to accomplish what is outlined in this proposal. The proposal also does not take into account the misalignment of incentives between businesses and consumers regarding advertising. (use brave browser as the example). Also I am wary of this project gaining any real traction given the sheer laziness of the average person who doesn't want an extra app or steps just to protect themselves. Businesses also are looking at spending 24 times the amount per impression based on the information given in the proposal.

vision of the proposer seems to be very clear only problem if any is the absence of core software developer in the management role. but I feel proposer seems passionate enough about this idea to pull it off.

You have mixed up the currencies: "20 days of senior blockchain developer @ 800 EUR per day – totaling 16.000 USD". Also, majority (69%) of your ask is dedicated to one person. Who is that senior developer who is being funded here?

There are many unanswered questions in the comments section. Please take those into account also.

I think it provides ample information for establishing confidence in its deliverables. More information regarding the onboarding process of marketing channels and hiw it could be deployed in social media platforms could strengthen a bit more the angle. It is a launching project with expected numbers joining but more clarity to the collaborative efforts and bridges needed to onboard big platforms would be greqt especially if its a model that cna be legally used to coerce best practice on web businesses across the net. Lovely idea keep up the great work!
The information provided is pretty clear with where the project plans to be in the future. It's ambitious and daring. I like. I would love to see what it would be in the future. Well done.
The proposal provides adequate information on the plan lacks details on how to go from development to millennial adoption

I'm not sure how feasible this is. It is mentioned that if the conditions set in the "smart contract" are broken a complaint to the data privacy authority can be made, but will these authorities accept a smart contract as a legally binding mechanisms. Also you'll need to constantly program new "smart contracts" to fit the different brand needs.

The CSS on the current profila website makes me want to pull my hair out. That said, there seems to be a clear and well thought out plan that explains the feasibility and plan to implement which will address the challenge.

proposer have provided sufficient information abt his idea and have answered and explained almost every question asked to him. this proposal meets all the criteria of the challenge. only thing to keep in mind is that its a long term project which might take multiple rounds of funding.

solution: Dapp and permission-based customer platform, using personal data-licensing smart contracts, which pays people for their attention.
experience: Privacy/Tech lawyer with 10Y XP in (project relevant) legal issues - consumer privacy; digital marketing; data rights & virtual currencies.
